prompt: Build me a pomodoro timer with dark mode

react-tailwind.summary: Best-in-class UI polish and component architecture, but missing customizable durations and skip control.

svelte-css.summary: Most feature-complete with settings panel and skip button, smallest compiled bundle, elegant CSS-variable theming.

vue-tailwind.summary: Clean Composition API usage but hampered by a notification bug, missing document title sync, and less visual polish.

vanilla-html-css-js.summary: Zero-dependency perfection for performance, but limited scalability and missing settings, skip, and keyboard shortcuts.

verdict: Svelte + Vanilla CSS wins by delivering the most complete Pomodoro experience — settings panel, skip control, and CSS-variable theming — while compiling to the smallest bundle of any framework option. React + Tailwind is an extremely close runner-up with superior UI polish, but the lack of customizable durations is a meaningful gap for a productivity tool.
